newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Autoliv to sell air bags to Volkswagen.
newsitem.headline: Autoliv to sell air bags to Volkswagen.

text.p: Swedish car safety equipment manufacturer Autoliv AB said on Thursday that it was to sell side air bags to Volkswagen but did not reveal financial details of the deal.
"Volkswagen .. has recently revealed that the company has begun to equip the Volkswagen Golf and the new Volkswagen Passat with side-impact air bags," Autoliv said in a statement.
Autoliv said it introduced the world's first side-impact airbags in 1994 and now it has orders for side collision protection equipment from 16 different car companies.
"This is our first order for airbags from Volkswagen and therefore an important breakthrough for Autoliv," Autoliv managing director Paul Charlety said in the statement.
The world market for side-impact air bags is expected to rise to 30 million bags by 2000 from less than half a million in 1995, Autoliv said.
